info.title: Frauddi API
info.description:
The Frauddi API is organized around REST. Our API has predictable resource-oriented URLs, accepts JSON-encoded request bodies, returns JSON-encoded responses, and uses standard HTTP response codes and authentication.

## Authentication

Authenticate API requests using your API key in the Authorization header:

```
Authorization: Bearer your_api_key_here
```

## Making Requests

All API requests should be made over HTTPS to the base URL. Request and response bodies are JSON.

## Response Format

All API responses follow a consistent structure with appropriate HTTP status codes. Successful requests return relevant data objects, while errors return detailed error information.

## Getting Started

1. Obtain your API key from the Frauddi dashboard or by contacting our sales team
2. Make a test request to the health check endpoint
3. Submit transaction data to assessment endpoints
4. Configure rules and thresholds for your use case

post.description:
Submit a payment charge for real-time fraud assessment.

    This endpoint processes the charge through multiple detection layers:
    - **Whitelist/Blacklist checking** - Verify against trusted and blocked entities
    - **Rule Engine** - Apply custom fraud detection rules
    - **ML Models** - Advanced pattern recognition and anomaly detection
    - **Graph Analysis** - Relationship mapping and network analysis
    - **Email Validation** - Email risk assessment and verification

    Returns a comprehensive risk assessment with decision rationale and score.

400.description: Invalid charge data or configuration error

post.description:
Validate and assess risk for customer email addresses.

    This endpoint analyzes email addresses for:
    - **Domain reputation** - Check email domain against threat databases
    - **Disposable email detection** - Identify temporary or throwaway emails
    - **Syntax validation** - Verify email format and structure
    - **Risk scoring** - Calculate fraud probability based on email patterns

    Returns assessment with email-specific risk indicators and recommendations.

400.description: Invalid email format or charge data

post.description:
Evaluate transaction risk using your custom fraud detection rules.

    This endpoint applies all active rules configured for your company and returns:
    - **Rule evaluation results** - Which rules matched and their outcomes
    - **Decision hierarchy** - Rule priority and decision logic
    - **Custom logic execution** - DSL-based business rules processing
    - **Threshold analysis** - Rule confidence scores and thresholds

    Rules are processed in priority order and can trigger various actions (ACCEPT, REVIEW, DECLINE).

400.description: Invalid charge data or rule configuration error

post.description:
Check transaction and customer data against your company's blacklists.

    This endpoint validates multiple data points against blacklisted entities:
    - **Email addresses** - Blocked customer emails
    - **IP addresses** - Suspicious or blocked IPs
    - **Card numbers** - Blocked payment methods (hashed for security)
    - **Phone numbers** - Blocked customer phone numbers
    - **Device fingerprints** - Blocked devices or browsers

    Returns immediate DECLINE decision if any blacklisted entity is detected.

Check transaction and customer data against your company's whitelists.

    This endpoint validates multiple data points against trusted entities:
    - **Email addresses** - Trusted customer emails
    - **IP addresses** - Trusted or corporate IPs
    - **Card numbers** - Trusted payment methods (hashed for security)
    - **Phone numbers** - Verified customer phone numbers
    - **Device fingerprints** - Trusted devices or browsers

    Returns immediate ACCEPT decision if any whitelisted entity is detected, bypassing other fraud checks.

get.description: Retrieve detailed information about a specific fraud assessment by its ID.

Retrieve a paginated list of assessments filtered by type.

    Available assessment types:
    - **CHARGE** - Full transaction assessments
    - **EMAIL** - Email validation assessments
    - **RULE** - Rules-based assessments
    - **BLACKLIST** - Blacklist check assessments
    - **WHITELIST** - Whitelist check assessments

    Results are ordered by creation date (newest first) and support pagination.

post.description: Create a new custom fraud detection rule using Frauddi's domain-specific language (DSL). Rules are evaluated in real-time during fraud assessments.

get.description: Retrieve a paginated list of all fraud detection rules for your company.

200.description: Successfully retrieved fraud detection rules with pagination

put.description: Update an existing fraud detection rule. The rule will be validated before applying changes.

delete.description: Permanently delete a fraud detection rule. This action cannot be undone.

get.description: Retrieve a specific fraud detection rule by its ID.

post.description: Test how your fraud detection rules would perform against historical transaction data without affecting live assessments. This endpoint allows you to optimize rule logic and validate effectiveness before deploying to production.

200.description: Successfully simulated fraud detection rules with performance metrics

post.description: Add a value to the blacklist for automated fraud prevention. Accepts customer emails, phone numbers, or payment card hashes. Blacklisted values will automatically trigger fraud alerts in future assessments.

example.detail: The blacklist could not be added.

get.description: Retrieve all blacklist entries with pagination. Returns customer emails, phone numbers, and payment card hashes currently blocked by fraud prevention system.

200.description: Successfully retrieved blacklist entries with pagination

put.description: Modify an existing blacklist entry. Updates the value (email, phone number, or card hash) and metadata while preserving the entry's fraud prevention status.

delete.description: Remove a value from the blacklist. Deleted entries (email, phone number, or card hash) will no longer trigger fraud alerts in future assessments.

example.detail: The blacklist could not be deleted.

get.description: Get details of a specific blacklist entry including its value (email, phone number, or card hash), type, and metadata.

post.description: Add a value to the whitelist for fraud prevention bypass. Accepts customer emails, phone numbers, or payment card hashes. Whitelisted values will automatically be excluded from fraud alerts in future assessments.

example.detail: The whitelist could not be added.

get.description: Retrieve all whitelist entries with pagination. Returns customer emails, phone numbers, and payment card hashes currently excluded from fraud prevention system.

200.description: Successfully retrieved whitelist entries with pagination

put.description: Modify an existing whitelist entry. Updates the value (email, phone number, or card hash) and metadata while preserving the entry's fraud prevention bypass status.

delete.description: Remove a value from the whitelist. Deleted entries (email, phone number, or card hash) will no longer be excluded from fraud alerts in future assessments.

get.description: Get details of a specific whitelist entry including its value (email, phone number, or card hash), type, and metadata.

post.description: Create a backup snapshot of specified data collections. Snapshot creation runs asynchronously in the background.

get.description: Retrieve all snapshots with pagination. Returns snapshot history including creation dates, status, and collection information.
Get detailed information about a specific snapshot including its status, creation date, and collections included.

delete.description: Permanently delete a snapshot and all its associated data. This action cannot be undone.

get.description: Retrieve detailed metadata about a snapshot including collection statistics, data counts, and snapshot integrity information.

post.description: Restore data from a snapshot to specified collections. Restoration runs asynchronously in the background and may overwrite existing data.

get.description: Retrieve all restore operations for a specific snapshot with pagination. Shows restore history including status and timestamps.

parameters.name: page_size

schema.description: Number of restore operations per page
schema.title: Page Size

parameters.description: Number of restore operations per page

get.description: Retrieve detailed information about a specific restore operation including status, progress, and any errors encountered.

post.description: Compare two snapshots to identify differences in fraud detection module data, providing detailed change analysis for audit and rollback purposes.

200.description: Detailed comparison showing differences between snapshots

404.description: One or both snapshots not found

422.description: Invalid snapshot IDs or comparison parameters

post.description:
Create a new data aggregation rule for analytics and pattern detection.

    Aggregations allow you to:
    - **Monitor transaction patterns** - Track volume, velocity, and behavior over time
    - **Set detection thresholds** - Define limits for suspicious activity
    - **Analyze customer behavior** - Aggregate data by customer, location, or device
    - **Create custom metrics** - Build business-specific fraud indicators
    - **Real-time monitoring** - Continuous evaluation of aggregated data

    Perfect for velocity checks, spending pattern analysis, and behavioral anomaly detection.

get.description: Retrieve a paginated list of all analytics aggregation rules for your company.

200.description: Successfully retrieved aggregation rules with pagination

put.description: Update an existing analytics aggregation rule configuration, including thresholds, time windows, and monitoring parameters.

delete.description: Permanently delete an analytics aggregation rule. This action cannot be undone.

get.description: Retrieve a specific analytics aggregation rule by its ID.

Get the list of available fields that can be used in analytics aggregations.

    Returns all transaction and customer fields that can be aggregated including:
    - **Transaction fields** - amount, currency, status, timestamps
    - **Customer fields** - email, phone, location, device data
    - **Payment fields** - card type, BIN, payment method
    - **Metadata fields** - Custom fields from transaction metadata

    Use these fields to build custom aggregation rules for pattern detection.
Get detailed descriptions and data types for all available aggregation fields.
Get analytics events triggered for a specific transaction charge.

200.description: List of aggregation events for the charge

get.description: Get detailed logs of analytics events for a specific transaction charge.

200.description: Detailed logs of aggregation events for the charge

post.description: Execute optimized anomaly detection using isolation forest algorithm to identify unusual patterns in transaction data efficiently.

200.description: Detected anomalies with confidence scores and optimization metrics

422.description: Invalid request parameters or malformed data

post.description: Automatically discover the most important concentration patterns in your data without specifying fields in advance. Uses DataSpot's discovery algorithm.
Find where your data concentrates across specified fields using DataSpot's pattern detection. Includes configurable filtering options and depth control.

200.description: Found concentration patterns in specified fields

post.description: Conduct deep statistical analysis on data patterns using DataSpot. Provides confidence scores, statistical significance, and actionable insights for each pattern.

200.description: Statistical analysis results with insights and confidence scores

post.description: Compare data patterns between current and baseline periods using DataSpot. Detects changes, new patterns, and disappeared patterns for A/B testing and trend analysis.

200.description: Temporal comparison results with change detection

get.description: Retrieve categorized list of fields available for anomaly analysis including customer, payment, and charge fields.

200.description: Categorized list of available fields for analysis

get.description: Get detailed information about a specific charge including transaction data, customer information, and assessment results.

200.description: Charge details with transaction and assessment data

get.description: Retrieve all charges with pagination. Returns transaction history including amounts, customer data, and fraud assessment results.

200.description: Paginated list of charges with transaction details

get.description:
Retrieve the relationship graph data for a specific customer showing all connected entities.

    This endpoint returns network analysis data including:
    - **Connected customers** - Other customers linked through shared attributes
    - **Relationship strength** - Confidence scores for connections
    - **Graph nodes** - Customer entities with their properties
    - **Graph edges** - Relationships between customers with metadata
    - **Visualization data** - Optimized for D3.js, vis.js, or Cytoscape libraries

    Perfect for fraud ring detection, customer network analysis, and relationship visualization.

parameters.name: customer_id

schema.description: Customer ID to analyze relationships for
schema.title: Customer Id

parameters.description: Customer ID to analyze relationships for

post.description:
Add a new customer to the relationship graph and automatically detect connections.

    This endpoint performs intelligent relationship detection based on shared attributes:
    - **Email addresses** - Exact and domain-based matching
    - **Phone numbers** - Direct number matching
    - **Card numbers** - Secure hash-based matching
    - **IP addresses** - Geographic and exact IP matching
    - **Device fingerprints** - Browser/device identification
    - **Address data** - Physical location correlation

    The system automatically calculates relationship strength and identifies potential fraud rings.

get.description:
Get comprehensive analytics and statistics for a customer's relationship network.

    This endpoint provides deep insights into customer relationships including:
    - **Network metrics** - Connection count, cluster size, centrality scores
    - **Risk indicators** - Network-based risk patterns and anomalies
    - **Transaction analytics** - Aggregated transaction data across the network
    - **Behavioral patterns** - Shared behaviors and suspicious activities
    - **Chargeback analysis** - Network-wide chargeback rates and patterns

    Essential for fraud investigation, risk assessment, and customer profiling with 360 network visibility.

parameters.name: customer_id

schema.description: Customer ID to analyze network statistics for
schema.title: Customer Id

parameters.description: Customer ID to analyze network statistics for

get.description: Retrieve the execution pipeline configuration for a company, including rule priorities, execution order, and stop conditions.

200.description: Execution configuration with prioritized rules and control settings

404.description: Configuration not found for this company

put.description: Replace the execution configuration with new rule priorities, execution order, and control settings. Maintains configuration ID while updating all items.

200.description: Updated execution configuration with new settings applied

404.description: Configuration not found for this company

post.description: Create a new execution pipeline configuration defining rule execution order, priorities, and control flow for fraud detection.

201.description: Created execution configuration with generated IDs and applied settings

409.description: Configuration already exists for this company

get.description: Retrieve the decision-making configuration for a company, including score thresholds, risk levels, and action mappings for fraud detection outcomes.

200.description: Decision configuration with score thresholds and action rules

404.description: Decision configuration not found for this company

put.description: Replace the decision configuration with new score thresholds, risk levels, and action rules for fraud detection outcomes.

200.description: Updated decision configuration with new thresholds and actions

404.description: Decision configuration not found for this company

post.description: Create decision-making rules defining score thresholds, risk levels, and automated actions for fraud detection results.

201.description: Created decision configuration with defined thresholds and actions

409.description: Decision configuration already exists for this company

get.description: Retrieve machine learning model configuration for a company, including model parameters, feature engineering settings, and inference thresholds.

200.description: ML model configuration with parameters and inference settings

404.description: ML model configuration not found for this company

put.description: Replace the ML model configuration with new parameters, feature engineering settings, and inference thresholds for fraud detection models.

200.description: Updated ML model configuration with new parameters applied

404.description: ML model configuration not found for this company

post.description: Create machine learning model configuration defining model parameters, feature engineering pipeline, and inference settings for fraud detection.

201.description: Created ML model configuration with applied parameters

409.description: ML model configuration already exists for this company

get.description: Retrieve current company information including name, description, and legal representative details based on authentication token.
Main endpoint for the application.
Ping/Pong endpoint for the application.

customer_id.title: Customer Id
customer_id.description: Unique customer identifier. Must be unique across the system.

email.title: Email
email.description: Customer email address. Must be a valid email format.

phone.title: Phone
phone.description: Customer phone number including country code. Must be a valid phone format.

card_number.title: Card Number
card_number.description: Customer card number (digits only). Can be full card number (13-19 digits), BIN (6-8 digits), or last 4 digits. Should be masked or tokenized for security.

merchant_id.title: Merchant Id
merchant_id.description: Merchant identifier associated with this customer. Optional field.

ip_addresses.title: Ip Addresses
ip_addresses.description: List of IP addresses associated with this customer's transactions.

device_ids.title: Device Ids
device_ids.description: List of device identifiers used by this customer.

acceptance.title: Acceptance
acceptance.description: Number of accepted transactions for this customer. Must be non-negative.

declined.title: Declined
declined.description: Number of declined transactions for this customer. Must be non-negative.

chargeback_fraud.title: Chargeback Fraud
chargeback_fraud.description: Number of fraud-related chargebacks. Must be non-negative.

chargeback_authorization.title: Chargeback Authorization
chargeback_authorization.description: Number of authorization-related chargebacks. Must be non-negative.

chargeback_processing_error.title: Chargeback Processing Error
chargeback_processing_error.description: Number of processing error chargebacks. Must be non-negative.

chargeback_customer_dispute.title: Chargeback Customer Dispute
chargeback_customer_dispute.description: Number of customer dispute chargebacks. Must be non-negative.

chargeback_non_receipt.title: Chargeback Non Receipt
chargeback_non_receipt.description: Number of non-receipt chargebacks. Must be non-negative.

chargeback_cancelled_recurring.title: Chargeback Cancelled Recurring
chargeback_cancelled_recurring.description: Number of cancelled recurring transaction chargebacks. Must be non-negative.

chargeback_product_not_received.title: Chargeback Product Not Received
chargeback_product_not_received.description: Number of product not received chargebacks. Must be non-negative.

chargeback_duplicate_processing.title: Chargeback Duplicate Processing
chargeback_duplicate_processing.description: Number of duplicate processing chargebacks. Must be non-negative.

AddCustomerRequest.title: AddCustomerRequest
AddCustomerRequest.description: Request model for adding a new customer to the graph.

AggregationEventListResponse.title: AggregationEventListResponse
AggregationEventListResponse.description: Pydantic model for aggregation event list response.

AggregationEventLogListResponse.title: AggregationEventLogListResponse
AggregationEventLogListResponse.description: Pydantic model for aggregation event log list response.

AggregationFieldsResponse.title: AggregationFieldsResponse
AggregationFieldsResponse.description: Pydantic model for aggregation fields response.

AggregationListResponse.title: AggregationListResponse
AggregationListResponse.description: Pydantic model for aggregation list response.

name.title: Name
name.description: Name identifier for the aggregation. Must be unique, start with a letter, and contain only letters, numbers, underscores, and hyphens.

value.title: Value
value.description: Aggregation expression containing metrics in format 'entity:period:metric'. Valid entities: card, customer, company. Valid periods: 5m, 10m, 15m, 30m, 1h, 3h, 6h, 12h, 1d. Valid metrics: count, sum, avg, successful, declined, unique_companies, unique_customers, unique_cards, unique_ips, success_rate, decline_rate, velocity, median, std, min, max, p90, p95, p99, round_ratio, shannon_entropy, company_diversity.

periods.title: Periods
periods.description: List of time periods (in minutes) for which to calculate aggregations. Valid periods: 5, 10, 15, 30, 60 (1h), 180 (3h), 360 (6h), 720 (12h), 1440 (1d). Must contain at least one period.

AggregationRequest.title: AggregationRequest
AggregationRequest.description: Pydantic model for the aggregation request object.

AggregationResponse.title: AggregationResponse
AggregationResponse.description: Pydantic model for the aggregation response object.

AggregationRules.title: AggregationRules
AggregationRules.description: Represents an aggregation rule in the antifraud system.

fields.title: Fields
fields.description: Fields to analyze statistically. Must specify at least one field name from the charges collection.

query.title: Query
query.description: MongoDB query filters for data retrieval. Use standard MongoDB query syntax.

from_date.title: From Date
from_date.description: Start date for data analysis. ISO format with timezone.

to_date.title: To Date
to_date.description: End date for data analysis. Must be after from_date if specified.

min_percentage.title: Min Percentage
min_percentage.description: Minimum percentage threshold for statistical analysis. Only patterns representing at least this percentage will be analyzed in detail.

fields.title: Fields
fields.description: Fields to compare between periods. Must specify at least one field name from the charges collection.

current_from_date.title: Current From Date
current_from_date.description: Start date for current period analysis. Must be before current_to_date.

current_to_date.title: Current To Date
current_to_date.description: End date for current period analysis. Must be after current_from_date.

baseline_from_date.title: Baseline From Date
baseline_from_date.description: Start date for baseline period analysis. Must be before baseline_to_date.

baseline_to_date.title: Baseline To Date
baseline_to_date.description: End date for baseline period analysis. Must be after baseline_from_date.

query.title: Query
query.description: MongoDB query filters applied to both periods. Use standard MongoDB query syntax.

change_threshold.title: Change Threshold
change_threshold.description: Threshold for detecting significant changes (0.01 = 1%, 1.0 = 100%). Changes above this threshold will be highlighted.

statistical_significance.title: Statistical Significance
statistical_significance.description: Include statistical significance tests in the analysis. Provides p-values and confidence intervals for detected changes.

current_records.title: Current Records
current_records.description: Number of records in current period

baseline_records.title: Baseline Records
baseline_records.description: Number of records in baseline period

added_patterns.title: Added Patterns
added_patterns.description: New patterns found in current period

query.title: Query
query.description: MongoDB query filters for data retrieval. Use standard MongoDB query syntax.

from_date.title: From Date
from_date.description: Start date for data analysis. ISO format with timezone.

to_date.title: To Date
to_date.description: End date for data analysis. Must be after from_date if specified.

max_fields.title: Max Fields
max_fields.description: Maximum number of fields to analyze simultaneously. Higher values provide more detailed patterns but require more processing time.

min_percentage.title: Min Percentage
min_percentage.description: Minimum percentage threshold for pattern discovery. Only patterns representing at least this percentage of data will be discovered.

limit.title: Limit
limit.description: Maximum number of patterns to discover. Higher limits provide more comprehensive results but slower performance.

fields.title: Fields
fields.description: Ranking of fields by importance and concentration potential

customer_fields.title: Customer Fields
customer_fields.description: List of customer-related fields available for analysis

payment_fields.title: Payment Fields
payment_fields.description: List of payment-related fields available for analysis

charge_fields.title: Charge Fields
charge_fields.description: List of charge-related fields available for analysis

AnomalyFieldsResponse.title: AnomalyFieldsResponse
AnomalyFieldsResponse.description: Response model for available anomaly analysis fields.

fields.title: Fields
fields.description: Fields to analyze for patterns. Must specify at least one field name from the charges collection.

query.title: Query
query.description: MongoDB query filters for data retrieval. Use standard MongoDB query syntax.

from_date.title: From Date
from_date.description: Start date for data analysis. ISO format with timezone.

to_date.title: To Date
to_date.description: End date for data analysis. Must be after from_date if specified.

min_percentage.title: Min Percentage
min_percentage.description: Minimum percentage threshold for patterns. Only patterns representing at least this percentage will be included.

max_depth.title: Max Depth
max_depth.description: Maximum depth for pattern hierarchy. Higher depths provide more detailed analysis but require more processing.

contains.title: Contains
contains.description: Pattern must contain this string. Use for filtering patterns by specific values.

min_count.title: Min Count
min_count.description: Minimum count for patterns. Only patterns with at least this many occurrences will be included.

sort_by.title: Sort By
sort_by.description: Sort patterns by 'percentage' (default) or 'count'. Percentage sorts by relative frequency, count by absolute occurrences.

limit.title: Limit
limit.description: Maximum number of patterns to return. Higher limits provide more comprehensive results.

AnomalyFindRequest.title: AnomalyFindRequest
AnomalyFindRequest.description: Request model for finding concentration patterns.

AnomalyFindResponse.title: AnomalyFindResponse
AnomalyFindResponse.description: Result model for finding concentration patterns.

fields.title: Fields
fields.description: Fields to analyze for anomalies. Must specify at least one field name from the charges collection.

query.title: Query
query.description: MongoDB query filters for data retrieval. Use standard MongoDB query syntax.

from_date.title: From Date
from_date.description: Start date for data analysis. ISO format with timezone.

to_date.title: To Date
to_date.description: End date for data analysis. Must be after from_date if specified.

top.title: Top
top.description: Number of top elements to consider in optimization. Higher values provide more detailed analysis but slower performance.

min_value.title: Min Value
min_value.description: Minimum value threshold for optimization. Only patterns with at least this many occurrences will be included.

min_percentage.title: Min Percentage
min_percentage.description: Minimum percentage threshold for optimization. Only patterns representing at least this percentage will be included.

AnomalyOptimizedRequest.title: AnomalyOptimizedRequest
AnomalyOptimizedRequest.description: Request model for optimized anomaly detection.

patterns.title: Patterns
patterns.description: Optimized hierarchical tree structure of anomalies

AnomalyOptimizedResult.title: AnomalyOptimizedResult
AnomalyOptimizedResult.description: Result model for optimized anomaly detection.

value.title: Value
value.description: Value to be blacklisted. Accepts customer emails, phone numbers, or payment card hashes. Cannot be empty.

expire_at.title: Expire At
expire_at.description: Expiration date and time for the blacklist entry. Defaults to 1 year from creation.

BlacklistRequest.title: BlacklistRequest
BlacklistRequest.description: Pydantic model for the blacklist object.

BlacklistResponse.title: BlacklistResponse
BlacklistResponse.description: Pydantic model for the blacklist object.

charge_id.title: Charge Id
charge_id.description: Unique identifier for the charge transaction.

status.title: Status
status.description: Current status of the charge. Must be one of: pending, completed, failed, cancelled, refunded, paid. Defaults to 'pending'.

customer.description: Customer information associated with this charge.

metadata.title: Metadata
metadata.description: Additional metadata for the charge. Can contain any custom fields relevant to your business logic or fraud detection rules.

ChargeRequest.title: ChargeRequest
ChargeRequest.description: Pydantic model for charge creation requests.

ChargebackSubcategoryResponse.title: ChargebackSubcategoryResponse
ChargebackSubcategoryResponse.description: Chargeback subcategory with count and percentage.

applied.title: Applied
applied.description: Number of charges this rule applied to

ids.title: Ids
ids.description: List of charge IDs (populated if include_charge_ids=True)

name.title: Name
name.description: Decision strategy name. Must be one of: ACCEPT_PRIORITY (accept takes precedence), REJECT_PRIORITY (reject takes precedence), or MAJORITY_RULE (majority vote decides).

description.title: Description
description.description: Optional description explaining when and how this decision strategy should be used.
examples: Use when fraud detection is high priority

enabled.title: Enabled
enabled.description: Whether this decision strategy is currently active. Only one strategy can be enabled at a time.

ConfigurationDecisionItemRequest.title: ConfigurationDecisionItemRequest
ConfigurationDecisionItemRequest.description: Request model for a decision configuration item.

ConfigurationDecisionItemResponse.title: ConfigurationDecisionItemResponse
ConfigurationDecisionItemResponse.description: Response model for a decision strategy item.

configuration.title: Configuration
configuration.description: List of decision strategies configuration. Must contain at least one strategy and exactly one must be enabled. Maximum 3 strategies allowed.

ConfigurationDecisionRequest.title: ConfigurationDecisionRequest
ConfigurationDecisionRequest.description: Request model for decision configuration creation.

ConfigurationDecisionResponse.title: ConfigurationDecisionResponse
ConfigurationDecisionResponse.description: Response model for decision configuration with strategies.

ConfigurationExecutionItemResponse.title: ConfigurationExecutionItemResponse
ConfigurationExecutionItemResponse.description: Response model for a configuration item.

configuration.title: Configuration
configuration.description: List of execution configuration items ordered by priority. Each item must have a unique priority and name. Maximum 20 items allowed for performance.

ConfigurationExecutionResponse.title: ConfigurationExecutionResponse
ConfigurationExecutionResponse.description: Response model for configuration with items.

priority.title: Priority
priority.description: Execution priority order. Lower numbers execute first. Must be unique across all items in the configuration.

name.title: Name
name.description: Descriptive name for this configuration item. Must be unique and descriptive.

type.title: Type
type.description: Type of fraud detection component to execute. Must be one of: BLACKLISTS (block known bad actors), WHITELISTS (allow trusted entities), RULES (custom business logic).

description.title: Description
description.description: Optional detailed description of what this configuration item does and when it should be used.
examples: Checks customer email against known fraud database

enabled.title: Enabled
enabled.description: Whether this configuration item is active. Disabled items are skipped during execution.

stop_on_match.title: Stop On Match
stop_on_match.description: Whether to stop processing remaining items if this one matches/triggers. Use for high-confidence blocking rules.

ConfigurationItemRequest.title: ConfigurationItemRequest
ConfigurationItemRequest.description: Request model for a configuration item.

id.title: Id
id.description: Unique identifier for the ML model configuration. Must be unique across all model configurations.

name.title: Name
name.description: ML model strategy name. PROTECTIVE (high security, low false positives), PERMISSIVE (balanced approach), OPTIMIZED (maximum performance, may have more false positives).

description.title: Description
description.description: Optional description explaining the model's behavior, use cases, and expected performance characteristics.
examples: High precision fraud detection with minimal false positives
Balanced model for general use cases

enabled.title: Enabled
enabled.description: Whether this ML model configuration is currently active and available for use.

ConfigurationModelItemRequest.title: ConfigurationModelItemRequest
ConfigurationModelItemRequest.description: Request model for a ML model configuration item.

ConfigurationModelItemResponse.title: ConfigurationModelItemResponse
ConfigurationModelItemResponse.description: Response model for a ML model configuration item.

configuration.title: Configuration
configuration.description: List of ML model configurations. Each configuration must have unique ID and name. Maximum 10 configurations allowed.

ConfigurationModelRequest.title: ConfigurationModelRequest
ConfigurationModelRequest.description: Request model for ML model configuration creation.

ConfigurationModelResponse.title: ConfigurationModelResponse
ConfigurationModelResponse.description: Response model for ML model configuration with items.

full_name.title: Full Name
full_name.description: Full name of the customer making the transaction.

phone_number.title: Phone Number
phone_number.description: Customer's phone number including country code. Must be a valid phone format.

email.title: Email
email.description: Customer's email address. Must be a valid email format.

ip_address.title: Ip Address
ip_address.description: Customer's IP address (IPv4 or IPv6 format). Accepts standard IP formats.

fingerprint.title: Fingerprint
fingerprint.description: Unique device/browser fingerprint for fraud detection.

CustomerRequest.title: CustomerRequest
CustomerRequest.description: Pydantic model for customer data in charge requests.

CustomerResponse.title: CustomerResponse
CustomerResponse.description: Pydantic model for customer data in charge responses.

CustomerStatsResponse.title: CustomerStatsResponse
CustomerStatsResponse.description: Individual customer statistics with complete profile data.

customer_details.description: Complete profile and statistics of the requested customer

ImpactStats.title: ImpactStats
ImpactStats.description: Statistics showing the impact of new rules.

has_previous.title: Has Previous
has_previous.description: Whether there is a previous page available

has_next.title: Has Next
has_next.description: Whether there is a next page available

PaginationMetadata.title: PaginationMetadata
PaginationMetadata.description: Pagination metadata model for list responses.

currency.title: Currency
currency.description: ISO 4217 currency code (3 uppercase letters). Defaults to USD.

amount.title: Amount
amount.description: Transaction amount. Must be positive and not exceed 999,999.99.

fee.title: Fee
fee.description: Processing fee amount. Must be non-negative.

card_hash.title: Card Hash
card_hash.description: Hashed card number for security. Must not contain actual card number.

card_type.title: Card Type
card_type.description: Type of card used. Must be either 'credit' or 'debit'.

exp_month.title: Exp Month
exp_month.description: Card expiration month in MM format (01-12).

brand.title: Brand
brand.description: Card brand/network. Must be one of the supported brands.

bin_number.title: Bin Number
bin_number.description: Bank Identification Number (BIN) from the card. Can be 1 to 10 digits.

cvc.title: Cvc
cvc.description: Card Verification Code (3-4 digits). Should be encrypted/hashed.

PaymentRequest.title: PaymentRequest
PaymentRequest.description: Pydantic model for payment data in charge requests.

PaymentResponse.title: PaymentResponse
PaymentResponse.description: Pydantic model for payment data in charge responses.

RuleListResponse.title: RuleListResponse
RuleListResponse.description: Pydantic model for rule list response.

value.title: Value
value.description: Rule expression using boolean logic operators (and, or, not) and comparison operators (==, !=, <, >, <=, >=). Can reference charge fields like payment.amount, customer.email, status, or aggregation metrics like card:5m:count. Cannot be empty.

decision.title: Decision
decision.description: Decision action when rule matches. Must be either ACCEPT or REJECT in uppercase.

expire_at.title: Expire At
expire_at.description: Expiration date and time for the rule. Defaults to 1 year from creation.

RuleRequest.title: RuleRequest
RuleRequest.description: Pydantic model for the rule object.

RuleResponse.title: RuleResponse
RuleResponse.description: Pydantic model for the rule object.

from_date.title: From Date
from_date.description: Start date for the simulation period. Must be before to_date.

to_date.title: To Date
to_date.description: End date for the simulation period. Must be after from_date.

rules.title: Rules
rules.description: List of rules to simulate. Must contain at least one rule.

include_charge_ids.title: Include Charge Ids
include_charge_ids.description: Whether to include individual charge IDs in rule application results. Default is False for performance.

Snapshot.title: Snapshot
Snapshot.description: Document model representing a snapshot of data with metadata.

baseline_snapshot_id.title: Baseline Snapshot Id
baseline_snapshot_id.description: ID of the baseline snapshot to compare against. This is the reference point for comparison.

current_snapshot_id.title: Current Snapshot Id
current_snapshot_id.description: ID of the current snapshot to compare. This will be compared against the baseline.

SnapshotCompareRequest.title: SnapshotCompareRequest
SnapshotCompareRequest.description: SnapshotCompareRequest model representing a request to compare two snapshots.

SnapshotCompareResponse.title: SnapshotCompareResponse
SnapshotCompareResponse.description: SnapshotCompareResponse model representing the comparison result between two snapshots.

SnapshotListResponse.title: SnapshotListResponse
SnapshotListResponse.description: Pydantic model for snapshot list response.

SnapshotMetadataResponse.title: SnapshotMetadataResponse
SnapshotMetadataResponse.description: Pydantic model for snapshot metadata response.

description.title: Description
description.description: Optional description for the snapshot to help identify its purpose.

collections.title: Collections
collections.description: List of fraud detection modules to include in the snapshot. Available modules: RULES, BLACKLISTS, WHITELISTS, ASSESSMENTS, AGGREGATIONS, ANOMALIES, SCORES.

drop_existing.title: Drop Existing
drop_existing.description: Whether to drop existing module data before restoring. Use with caution as this is destructive.

SnapshotRequest.title: SnapshotRequest
SnapshotRequest.description: SnapshotRequest model representing a request for a snapshot.

SnapshotResponse.title: SnapshotResponse
SnapshotResponse.description: SnapshotResponse model representing a snapshot of data with metadata.

SnapshotRestore.title: SnapshotRestore
SnapshotRestore.description: Document model representing a snapshot of data with metadata.

SnapshotRestoreListResponse.title: SnapshotRestoreListResponse
SnapshotRestoreListResponse.description: Pydantic model for snapshot restore list response.

SnapshotRestoreResponse.title: SnapshotRestoreResponse
SnapshotRestoreResponse.description: SnapshotRestoreResponse model representing a snapshot of data with metadata.

value.title: Value
value.description: Value to be whitelisted. Accepts customer emails, phone numbers, or payment card hashes. Must not be empty.

expire_at.title: Expire At
expire_at.description: Expiration date for this whitelist entry. Defaults to 1 year from creation.

WhitelistRequest.title: WhitelistRequest
WhitelistRequest.description: Pydantic model for the whitelist object.

WhitelistResponse.title: WhitelistResponse
WhitelistResponse.description: Pydantic model for the whitelist object.
